alert.note: Alert for Crow Wing; North Cass; North Itasca; South Cass; South Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 8:26PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Itasca, Cass and northwestern Crow Wing Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 826 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles southeast of Turtle River, to 8 miles east of Poplar, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Pequot Lakes and Pine River around 840 PM CDT. Crosslake around 850 PM CDT. Fifty Lakes around 855 PM CDT. Wabedo, Squaw Lake and Oslund around 900 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Lake Roosevelt, Lower Hay Lake, Pheasant Lake, Max, Lake Ada, Portage Lake, Ball Club Lake, Decker Lake, Mud Lake and Ten Mile Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for north central and east central Minnesota.

area.areaDesc: Crow Wing; North Cass; North Itasca; South Cass; South Itasca
